description.narrative: CAFOD has been working with Caritas Bangladesh over a number of years to strengthening their accountability to the people and communities they serve and to protect their staff. Support has included protection mainstreaming training, some short term safeguarding sessions and support to develop a Safeguarding Policy which approved by Caritas Bangladesh's General Body in May 2019. Caritas Bangladesh has now developed a strategic and holistic project to train all their staff and volunteers (over 6,000 people) across Bangladesh on the Safeguarding Policy, to strengthen systems and practices around safeguarding and to ensure all people, including children, young people, women and vulnerable adults are adequately protected within Caritas Bangladesh's work. The project will include design materials, strengthening systems and training all staff and volunteers. Additionally, it includes developing a holistic and transparent feedback and complaints mechanism across the organisation. Due to the size of this work, Caritas Bangladesh will be jointly supported by a working group from CAFOD, CRS, Caritas Australia and Caritas Denmark. This group will include technical safeguarding experts including support from CAFOD's Safeguarding Advisor. The project is jointly funded by these organisations in support of Caritas Bangladesh.
